_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies 

Ben & Jerry's, St. Alban's Vermont, has and will continue to be concerned with all aspects of the environment, health, and safety issues.  Releases are prevented by a combination of engineering and administrative controls.  Administrative controls involve manual isolation and shutdown procedures to be performed by trained personnel.  The system is also equipped with pressure relief valves that operate to prevent damage to system components should pressure reach unsafe levels.  Operation of pressure relief valves will result in a controlled release of refrigerant.



Facility and Regulated Substance Handled

Because of the nature of ice-cream based products, the manufacturing process at Ben & Jerry's includes refrigeration systems to ensure that the ice cream products remain in their intended frozen states.



Ben & Jerry's utilizes anhydrous ammonia in its refrigeration system. The anhydrous ammonia triggers the requirement of EPA 40 CFR Part 68, Risk Management Plan, because the facility's refrigeration system has 78,852 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.



Our facility is located at 900 Industrial Park Road, St. Alban's, Vermont   05478.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response

Ben & Jerry's Homemade, Inc. is involved in an ongoing effort to comply with OSHA 1910.119 Process Safety Management requirements as well as EPA 40 CFR Part 68, Risk Management Plan for accident prevention planning, training and response.  



Five Year Accident History

This facility has not experienced any reportable accidents in the past five (5) years.
